news_header: Arto Salomaa, a renowned mathematician and professor, passed away at the age of 90. He was known for his work in DNA calculation, mathematical logic, and cryptography.
news_text: Arto Salomaa, an internationally respected mathematician and professor, died at the age of 90. His research career spanned several decades, focusing on mathematical logic, formal languages, and automatic theory. Salomaa was particularly interested in the intersection of mathematics and computers during the 1960s and contributed to the mathematical theory of cryptography and DNA calculation. He earned his PhD from the University of Turku in 1959 and served as a professor there from 1966 to 1999, also holding visiting professorships abroad. Salomaa was honored as a doctor at multiple universities and became a member of the Finnish Academy of Science and Letters in 1970. He was recognized as Professor of the Year in 1993 and balanced his academic life with family, enjoying sauna and classical music.
